Aristotle claimed that people might become slaves due to some aspect of or flaw in their character. He also claimed that the innate qualities of women consigned them to a subordinate role to men in society. There were a number of things he believed about the natural world that turned out to be erroneous. Some of his theories about drama and politics are shaky. On the other hand, the Nichomachean Ethics is a priceless work, and so is his work on constitutions, politics, and drama. Also his Metaphysics. Aristotle’s great contribution to Western thought was to emphasize the value of drawing conclusions from observed data in the everyday world, getting away from idealism and a priori thought. He was a proponent of the scientific method. Unfortunately, like everyone else, he wasn’t always able to put his pre-assumptions aside.
